org.jpac
Class ProcessEvent

java.lang.Object
  org.jpac.Fireable
      org.jpac.ProcessEvent
Direct Known Subclasses:
AlarmAcknowledged, AlarmGone, AlarmRaised, ConjunctiveEvent, DecimalChanges, DecimalExceeds, DecimalFallsBelow, DisjunctiveEvent, EmergencyStopAcknowledged, ExclusiveDisjunctiveEvent, ImpossibleEvent, LogicalBecomes, LogicalState, LogicalToggles, NextCycle, NthCycle, PeriodOfTime, SignalInvalid, SignalValid, SignedIntegerChanges, SignedIntegerExceeds, SignedIntegerFallsBelow, TimerExpires
public abstract class ProcessEvent
extends Fireable

base class for all process events which can be await()ed by modules

                throws ProcessException
used to check, if an process event is currently fired

Overrides:
isFired in class Fireable

Throws:
ProcessException

await

public ProcessEvent await(long nanoseconds)
                   throws EventTimedoutException,
                          EmergencyStopException,
                          ShutdownRequestException,
                          ProcessException,
                          OutputInterlockException,
                          InputInterlockException,
                          MonitorException,
                          InconsistencyException
used to await the process event. Can be called inside the work() method of a module. The module is suspended, until the awaited process event occured (is fired).

Parameters:
nanoseconds: - maximum period of time to wait [ns]. In module contexts use helper values ns,millis,ms,sec to specify: 1000 * ms, 1 * sec, 1000 * millis
Returns:
the process event itself
Throws:
EventTimedoutException - thrown, if a time out occured
EmergencyStopException - thrown, if one of the other modules has encountered a emergency stop condition
ShutdownRequestException - thrown, if one of the other modules or the OS requests a shutdown of the elbfisch application
ProcessException - thrown, if an arbitrary process exception has been thrown
OutputInterlockException - thrown, if postCheckInterlocks() encountered an error condition
InputInterlockException - thrown, if preCheckInterlocks() encountered an error condition
MonitorException - thrown, if a monitored event occured
InconsistencyException - thrown, if JPac encountered an internal error

await

public ProcessEvent await()
                   throws EmergencyStopException,
                          ShutdownRequestException,
                          ProcessException,
                          OutputInterlockException,
                          InputInterlockException,
                          MonitorException,
                          InconsistencyException
used to await the process event. Can be called inside the work() method of a module. The module is suspended, until the awaited process event occured (is fired).

Returns:
the process event itself
Throws:
EventTimedoutException - thrown, if a time out occured
EmergencyStopException - thrown, if one of the other modules has encountered a emergency stop condition
ShutdownRequestException - thrown, if one of the other modules or the OS requests a shutdown of the elbfisch application
ProcessException - thrown, if an arbitrary process exception has been thrown
OutputInterlockException - thrown, if postCheckInterlocks() encountered an error condition
InputInterlockException - thrown, if preCheckInterlocks() encountered an error condition
MonitorException - thrown, if a monitored event occured
InconsistencyException - thrown, if JPac encountered an internal error

public ConjunctiveEvent and(ProcessEvent anotherProcessEvent)
used to implement a conjunctive process event inline

Parameters:
anotherProcessEvent - an process event which is "and'ed" to this process event
Returns:
the combined (conjunctive event)
